allOf.comment: Set Direction for requested move (does not apply to absolute move) True = Clockwise
set this true in program with oneshot to start homing, do not hold true in program as FB.Home() will continue to start at step 1
Call manual Clamp move method if true
Call manual Clamp move method if true
Call manual Rot Move method if true
Call manual Rot Move method if true
Call manual vert move method if true
Call manual vert move method if true
trigger this to begin a resync process [used after slippage or after individual jogging]
may need to change to a degree based system
may need to change to a degree based system
sync superjog manual move action bit
all systems go clearpath (if using asg)
counter/trigger to track how many increments of a output have been commanded
direction of motor rotation: CW is true;  CCW is false;
Set Direction for requested move (does not apply to absolute move)
degrees traveled per rev		(Calculate your own pitch and lead w/gearbox combo must set MechDriveType_CI to 8 to bypass internal calc)
degrees per pulse based on configuration inputs
degree position request from the program (input in absolute position and valid after homing)
difference in degrees from current position and requested position.  used to determine rotary direction
distance traveled per rev of final pulley (mm)
distance per pulse based on configuration inputs
distance traveled per rev		(Calculate your own pitch and lead w/gearbox combo must set MechDriveType_CI to 8 to bypass internal calc)
distanct position request from the program (input in absolute position and valid after homing)
difference in distance from current position and requested position.  used to determine linear direction
GearRatio motor to moving part (XX:1) (gearbox and lead included in calc for vert axis) (use this for pulleys as well)j
high level feedback 24v power if needed to used el2008 //default set to true so that hlfb is fucntional
HLFB configuration settings in cp (1:PPR   , 2:ASG Pos   , 3:ASG...   , 4:   , 5:  )
trigger position capture when homing ends
CP_FB homing settings - 0: disabled; 1: Home to low switch 2: home to hi switch 3: home with CP Drive and asg
input A of clearpath motor, output from plc
input B of clearpath motor, output from plc
0: default and will not work (CP defaults to 20ms filter)  7: set filter to less than scan time to be sure to catch all pulses for a chained move
Lead of Screw if used (mm)			(gearbox and lead included in calc for vert axis)
Call manual move method if true
Call manual move method if true
0: motor only(rot), 1: Motor and gear(rot), 2: Motor w/gear and screw(lin), 3: Motor w/screw only(lin), 4: Motor w/gear and pulley(lin),  5: Motor w/pulley(lin), 8: bypass mode
all ppr accounted for after move command
int counter to hold the number of pulses left to send
enable absolute move method to command pulses
software limit switch high (best to make this a retained or persistent variable) mm/deg
Software limit switch low (best to make this a retained or persistent variable) mm/deg
True if using the rotary sensor check feature (true sets Sensorcheck_PO =2; only use this if are using hardstops and dont need sensors;  Also check this homing method
checking if at least 2 of the rotary switches are working.  stops movement if false for bogie (how many sensors are on) 2 should be on at all times
check sum for inputb signal	(double check that direction is actually signaled to motor)
check if at least 2 rotary sensors are working for limit stop purposes
expected pulses from commanded movements at set PPR
turns on or off the configuration settings method so it only runs on first scan
Last known quadrant 1-4; Quadrant 0 is unknown position;
